name: kidney stone
description: Renal calculi or nephrolithiasis, refers to a solid concretion or crystal aggregation formed in the kidney from substances found in urine. These stones can vary in size, composition, and location. Imaging modalities, assess the size, location, and characteristics of kidney stones, aiding in diagnosis.

attributes.name: presence
attributes.description: This indicates whether kidney stone is present.

values.name: absent
values.description: This signifies no kidney stone is present.

values.name: present
values.description: It suggests kidney stone is present.

values.name: indeterminate
values.description: It suggests that it cannot be determined whether kidney stone is present.

values.name: unknown
values.description: It represents uncertainty regarding the presence of kidney stone.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: It indicates the anatomical region of the kidney stone.
